pr_title: MULE-17948: Add the concepts of connections URI and Descriptor on OCS

timeline.message: MULE-17948: Add the concepts of connections URI and Descriptor on OCS

timeline.author: elrodro83
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@ +/* + * Copyright (c) MuleSoft, Inc. All rights reserved. http://www.mulesoft.com + * The software in this package is published under the terms of the CPAL v1.0 + * license, a copy of which has been included with this distribution in the + * LICENSE.txt file. + */ +package org.mule.runtime.oauth.api; + +import org.mule.api.annotation.Experimental; +import org.mule.api.annotation.NoExtend; + +import java.util.Map; + +/** + * Describes the configuration of an OAuth connection managed by the Anypoint Platform. + *

+ * Platform Managed OAuth is an experimental feature. It will only be enabled on selected environments and scenarios. + * Backwards compatibility is not guaranteed. + * + * @since 4.3.0 + */ +@NoExtend +@Experimental +public interface PlatformManagedConnectionDescriptor { + + /** + * @return the connection's unique id in the Anypoint Platform + */ + String getId(); + + /** + * @return the URI that identifies this connection in the Anypoint Platform + */ + String getUri(); + + /** + * @return The name that the user has given this connection in the Anypoint Platform + */ + String getName(); + + /** + * Returns parameters additional to the standard OAuth ones that the user has configured for this connection. These usually + * correspond to custom parameters tha the service provider accepts or requires on its requests, but may contain other

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/modules/oauth-api/src/main/java/org/mule/runtime/oauth/api/PlatformManagedConnectionDescriptor.java b/modules/oauth-api/src/main/java/org/mule/runtime/oauth/api/PlatformManagedConnectionDescriptor.java
index f65a8266fda..6add82d3433 100644
--- a/modules/oauth-api/src/main/java/org/mule/runtime/oauth/api/PlatformManagedConnectionDescriptor.java
+++ b/modules/oauth-api/src/main/java/org/mule/runtime/oauth/api/PlatformManagedConnectionDescriptor.java

@@ -40,7 +40,7 @@ public interface PlatformManagedConnectionDescriptor {
 
   /**
    * Returns parameters additional to the standard OAuth ones that the user has configured for this connection. These usually
-   * correspond to custom parameters tha the service provider accepts or requires on its requests, but may contain other
+   * correspond to custom parameters that the service provider accepts or requires on its requests, but may contain other
    * parameters as well.
    *
    * @return A {@link Map} which keys are the parameter names

timeline.bodyText: parameters is to generic. Can this be renamed to getCustomParameters or getUserParameters?
timeline.author: elrodro83
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@ +/* + * Copyright (c) MuleSoft, Inc. All rights reserved. http://www.mulesoft.com + * The software in this package is published under the terms of the CPAL v1.0 + * license, a copy of which has been included with this distribution in the + * LICENSE.txt file. + */ +package org.mule.runtime.oauth.api; + +import org.mule.api.annotation.Experimental; +import org.mule.api.annotation.NoExtend; + +import java.util.Map; + +/** + * Describes the configuration of an OAuth connection managed by the Anypoint Platform. + *

+ * Platform Managed OAuth is an experimental feature. It will only be enabled on selected environments and scenarios. + * Backwards compatibility is not guaranteed. + * + * @since 4.3.0 + */ +@NoExtend +@Experimental +public interface PlatformManagedConnectionDescriptor { + + /** + * @return the connection's unique id in the Anypoint Platform + */ + String getId(); + + /** + * @return the URI that identifies this connection in the Anypoint Platform + */ + String getUri(); + + /** + * @return The name that the user has given this connection in the Anypoint Platform + */ + String getName(); + + /** + * Returns parameters additional to the standard OAuth ones that the user has configured for this connection. These usually + * correspond to custom parameters tha the service provider accepts or requires on its requests, but may contain other + * parameters as well. + * + * @return A {@link Map} which keys are the parameter names + */ + Map getParameters();

replies.bodyText: it's actually intentional. I didn't want it to be too specific as this might have unknown uses in the future. It's the same logic I asked you to follow yesterday on your PR's. If I change it as you ask, I not only risk having an API naming problem in the future, I also risk you asking me the same things I ask of you yesterday.
replies.author: marianogonzalez

index f65a8266fda..6add82d3433 100644
--- a/modules/oauth-api/src/main/java/org/mule/runtime/oauth/api/PlatformManagedConnectionDescriptor.java
+++ b/modules/oauth-api/src/main/java/org/mule/runtime/oauth/api/PlatformManagedConnectionDescriptor.java

   /**
    * Returns parameters additional to the standard OAuth ones that the user has configured for this connection. These usually
-   * correspond to custom parameters tha the service provider accepts or requires on its requests, but may contain other
+   * correspond to custom parameters that the service provider accepts or requires on its requests, but may contain other
    * parameters as well.
    *
    * @return A {@link Map} which keys are the parameter names
